1 Mathematical Identities This is Chapter 1. 1.1 LaTeX environments We can use equation envrionment as in LaTeX. \[\begin{equation} e^{i\pi}+1=0 \tag{1.1} \end{equation}\] Equation (1.1) is the Euler’s identity. 1.2 Bookdown environments These start with ::: {. } and end with :::. Theorem 1.1 (Euler's identity) \(e^{i\pi}+1=0\) The proof of Theorem 1.1 is as below: Proof. \[\begin{align*} e^{i\pi}+1&=\cos\pi+i\sin\pi+1\\ &=-1+i\times0+1=0 \end{align*}\] The proof is written in the same kind of environments as the theorem.

3 Labelling Environment Where label? When labelling When referencing Chapter/section After name {#chapter-name} \@ref(chapter-name) Equation Before/after equation (\#eq:euler) \@ref(eq:euler) Theorem 1st line of environment ::: {.theorem #identity} \@ref(thm:identity) Proof Can’t label N/A N/A Figure 1st line of environment ```{r plot-cars} \@ref(fig:plot-cars) It’s confusing! When labelling: apart from equations, don’t add the required prefix; relatedly, don’t use colon : in the label name or things will break. When referencing: apart from chapters/sections, add the required prefix; always use \@ref() so that referencing works in both html & pdf. In addition to colon :, avoid using underscore _ in labels as things might break; the hyphen - is the best bet.
